hobby.message: You flying analog or digital FPV drones these days?
Origami helping you dodge the spiral?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Yeah, doing fine. Just keeping my head down lately.
Could use more quiet, honestly. Been tough to relax.
Still squeeze in some time for flying drones, when I can.
City's not really hobby-friendly these days.
Things are running. Could be worse, with all the protests outside.
Mostly just decompress flying drones—my way to disappear for a bit.
Used to hit the old industrial zone. Now it’s tighter with patrols.
You notice tech acting weird since the breach?
I stick to empty spaces, not looking for trouble.
I'm holding up. Been spending time with my FPV drone runs—helps clear my head.
The city’s been heavy, especially after the BCI leak.
Usually fly at the cableworks, but patrols stepped up lately.
Had to cut a session short when the signals started glitching.
Feels like even hobbies get logged now if you’re not careful.
Still, catching good air over empty rooftops is something.
It's been strange. I fly freestyle drones to stay sane—FPV quads, fast and nimble.
After that data breach, sensors and patrols keep blocking my favorite spots.
Had a scare last week—lost signal, nearly lost my build in the old factory sector.
Kids still risk it out there, even with the lockdowns.
Honestly, watching a live feed through my goggles is the only time I forget everything else.
My score dipped after a flagged interaction—now I'm extra careful who sees me.
No one really expects drones, but you feel eyes everywhere these days.
I’m getting by, thanks. Freestyle drone flying’s my thing—FPV builds, custom patches, the works.
Been at it years. You get wired to the city’s pulse—old cableworks, rail yards, everywhere the network doesn’t quite reach.
Since the BCI leak, all the tech’s jumpy. City-wide lockdowns keep jamming my feed.
Lost almost an hour last time to interference. Patrol nearly tagged me for trespass, even though I just wanted a flight.
There were some kids out there, dodging patrols, same reason I was—none of us talk. Too risky now.
Every takeoff, my hands shake until the drone’s safe home. Never used to be like that.
Almost took a BCI hit but managed to keep my log clean. Had to reroute my own alerts.
Honestly, flying’s the last thing that still feels mine in this place.
hobby_answer: Yeah, still my therapy.
Hard to find quiet spots lately.
Patrols stepped up since the breach.
Flight times got a lot shorter.
Not worth the risk some days.
Yeah, FPV is still the best escape.
Signal’s messy out near the zones now.
Security drones everywhere since the protests.
You even fly too high, they tag you.
I stick to solo runs, no records, nothing uploaded.
Yeah, still flying—you know how I am about routines.
Cableworks are cramped now, patrols on new cycles.
That leak? Made every off-grid spot feel exposed.
I lost signal twice last session, almost scrubbed the drone.
No crowds anymore—just shadows.
Still, beats sitting at home with the feeds on.
Yeah, I still fly FPV—need it to think straight.
But the BCI breach changed everything.
Even the old cableworks aren't private now.
Patrol drones cross-check flight times, frequency hops get flagged.
Used to be just a handful of us out there, now it's emptier than ever.
Every time I fly, I watch my BCI dip, tick by tick.
Risk is part of it, but this is different.
I just miss when it felt like flying, not hiding.
Yeah, FPV is still my thing—always was better than any desk or doc.
Used to lose hours at the cableworks, no one cared.
After Halden died, system’s been paranoid—scans everything, even frequencies I spoofed for years.
The breach made it worse. Drones everywhere, less trust everywhere.
Met some kids last week hiding their transmitters, scared to share channels.
If a patrol catches your flight log, you get flagged, no appeal.
My BCI score dropped just for stopping near another flyer.
Feels like the city’s shrinking, not more empty, just more watched.
I still go, because if I don't, I start overthinking, and that’s worse.
